turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: England went out with a stress fracture.  That puts you in charge, lieutenant.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: McCool's that same rank.  We're both j.g.'s.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: You were commissioned one month earlier, which makes you the senior officer.  Remember.  There are no bad crews -- only bad leaders.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Simple question, lieutenant.  No reason not to answer.  What is your father's name?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: "Dad."

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Any brothers?  Sisters?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Dick, Jane, and Spot.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Are you hungry?  What's your favorite food?  We'll try to get it for you.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Green Eggs and Ham.  You're not going to get anywhere.  You might as well put me in the cage.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: You are in the cage, O'Neil.  Right here, right now.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Should I be afraid?

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Right down to your worthless womb, and I'll tell you why.  This is my island.  My world.  And here I can get away with shit that would get me arrested anywhere else in the world. Take another scan of my little joy- boy outside.  If I can do that to a Navy Seal, what's gonna happen to you?  Huh?

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Why didn't you shoot the woman, O'Neil?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Wasn't deemed a threat.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: She led us right to you.  That's no threat?

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Would you have shot if it was a man?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: No.  Yes.  I mean, depends on --

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: The others already told me, O'Neil. They wanted to shoot, but you wouldn't let them.  Because you went soft on another women --

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: That's not right.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: That's what your crew said.  Are they lying?  Or are you?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: I think you're the liar.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: I'm not the one who got five good men thrown in a bamboo cage.  You wear the bars, you made the call, and you got your whole crew --

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: We didn't know we were compromised. Firing would only've given away our position.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: You think we should go easy on women, O'Neil?

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Do you?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: I'm so glad we agree.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Didn't you know you'd be raped if you were captured?  Didn't you even think about that?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Sure.  Just like your men do.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: I think we oughtta practice it, just so you know what to expect.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Well, I'm trying to figure out if you're stupid, unlucky, gluttonous -- or some new alloy of all three.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Good to see you again, too, sir.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Okay, O'Neil.  So you've impressed all the others.  Now try me.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Managed to activate the ELB.  If you just radio base and let them know, they'll fix on that.  Oh, and make sure they send a helo with a winch -- door's blocked by a reef.  Over.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Chief, sir -- rescue team won't be here for 15 minutes.  What's your air situation?  Over.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Say again?  How many micks?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: 15, sir.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: Got it.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Show us where you are, Chief.

turns.speaker: THE CHIEF
turns.text: O'Neil...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Shut up, sir.  I'm concentrating.

turns.speaker: SLUTNIK
turns.text: Well, who the shit you think you are?  Comin' in here like that?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Your new roommate.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Anybody usin' these drawers here?

turns.speaker: SLUTNIK
turns.text: Hey, hey, HEY.  No possibility.  You can't stay in here.  You can't sleep right next to me.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Funny, the C.O. says I can.

turns.speaker: SLUTNIK
turns.text: Aw, lookit this, lookit this -- she's bringin' Tampax in here. C'mon, you got nothin' but rooms over there.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: That your desk?  I'll take this one.

turns.speaker: SLUTNIK
turns.text: WOULD YOU JUST GET OUTTA HERE?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Listen, Sex Ape.  I'm here to stay. And if you don't want me for a roommate or classmate, you got two options -- move out or ring out. End of file.

turns.speaker: SLUTNIK
turns.text: Clear.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: North?

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: All right, fire-and-evade maneuvers. Drop everything but weapons and the PRC radio -- we're gonna be high speed, low drag all the way to the link-up site.  Ready?

turns.speaker: SLUTNIK
turns.text: Sure.  Now she wants to shoot.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: MOVE!

turns.speaker: SLUTNIK
turns.text: I just wonder how that happened.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Cortez, see if you can dig out the tools without losing the rest of out gear.  Try a wrench on that thing.

turns.speaker: SLUTNIK
turns.text: You don't suppose this is just part of...

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: FLEA!  KEEP YOUR EYES ON THAT SPOT! Mark it, mark it!  Cortez?  What the hell you waiting for?

turns.speaker: SLUTNIK
turns.text: Maybe we should call the Coast Guard.

turns.speaker: JORDAN
turns.text: Shut your hole, Slutnik.

turns.speaker: MCCOOL
turns.text: We're fucked.

turns.speaker: SLUTNIK
turns.text: Darth Vader reads poetry...

turns.speaker: MCCOOL
turns.text: We are so fucked.

turns.speaker: SLUTNIK
turns.text: Can't live with them, can't kill them.  What's the point?

turns.speaker: MCCOOL
turns.text: Somebody throw a tent over this circus.

turns.speaker: MCCOOL
turns.text: You mind?  I'm trying to eat here.

turns.speaker: SLUTNIK
turns.text: So am I.

turns.speaker: SLUTNIK
turns.text: This ain't workin' right!

turns.speaker: MCCOOL
turns.text: What's our go-to-shit plan, O'Neil?

turns.speaker: SLUTNIK
turns.text: This ain't even workin' wrong!

turns.speaker: THE SPOOK
turns.text: Subject?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: O'Neil, Jordan.

turns.speaker: THE SPOOK
turns.text: Thought you two were file-closed.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: You knew about us?

turns.speaker: THE SPOOK
turns.text: Sorry.  Thought you knew I knew.

turns.speaker: THE SPOOK
turns.text: All right.  So who stands to gain if Jordan flames out in a big way?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: The E-Ringers?  Full integration is gonna cost the services billions at the worst possible time -- when Congress is already swinging the axe.

turns.speaker: THE SPOOK
turns.text: Congress cuts, military bleeds.  But Pentagon's a big place.  Let's narrow the sights.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: The Navy?  They've made it clear they don't want to pull missiles out of subs to make room for women's heads.  What's it gonna cost to make a fleet of Trident's co-ed?

turns.speaker: THE SPOOK
turns.text: Sabotage born of economics? Wouldn't be a first.  But is Hayes really going to start his watch with such a public failure?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Possibly.  Just to spite DeHaven.

turns.speaker: THE SPOOK
turns.text: Hmm.  Let's aim higher.

turns.speaker: THE SPOOK
turns.text: The White House.  If Jordan wins, DeHaven wins in spades.  Why?  Well, it's been said that the only man the President fears -- ain't no man.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: The first female President?

turns.speaker: THE SPOOK
turns.text: Don't for a second think she didn't leak this story.  "G.I. Jane" gives DeHaven a symbol that taps into the biggest constituency of them all.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Women.

turns.speaker: THE SPOOK
turns.text: If you were the President, wouldn't that put a little piss in your shoes?

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: I don't know.  Seems...

turns.speaker: THE SPOOK
turns.text: This ain't about some little soldier girl sloggin' her way through commando school.  The implications go way beyond.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Christ, I don't want to see her take a fall.  She thinks I do, but...

turns.speaker: THE SPOOK
turns.text: I take it this file is still open.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: Even tough I don't talk to her every day -- I still talk to her every day.  Know what I mean?

turns.speaker: THE SPOOK
turns.text: Okay, so now work it from the other end.  Think about California -- and how things might be handled there.

turns.speaker: ROYCE
turns.text: I don't...  What, someone on base?  A "mole"?

turns.speaker: THE SPOOK
turns.text: This is what you get for brain- picking an old CIA spook.  but if I needed to control the outcome of this test case, that's how I'd do it.  A man-in-place.  Makes everything very controllable.

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: That's cuz I'm married to you.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Shut up. How can you eat like that?

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: Big bites.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I'm telling you he's dirt. He's a douche bag, gutter slime, dog crap, puke chunks...

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: Hey, hey! I'm eating here!

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Audrey, you're too damned nice, that's your problem. Nice gets you nothin' in this town. You gotta be a killer to get ahead, you know what I'm sayin'? I'm sorry, baby, but you just don't got what it takes.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Audrey's going to stay with us tonight.

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: Great. See ya then.

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: Who the hell are all these people?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: What? I just couldn't just let them sleep in the street.

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: Where's Audrey?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: In the bedroom. Crying her eyes out because of you.

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: All that "you gotta be vicious" stuff you filled her head with.

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: Me!? You where the one...

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Go in there. Talk to her.

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: I like that image.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: You know how I spent last weekend? Walking his damned dog.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Animal, you don't think that's true, do you?

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: Nice guys finish last. First rule of the jungle.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Well, I can be tough if I want.

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: That why you dumped him?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: No! I just couldn't see myself with some boring egg head who spends his summer picking apart cockroaches. I wanted to have some adventure, some fun...

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: How long where you and dis guy goin' steady?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Nearly four years...

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Great stuff, Animal. Weren't you scared?

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: Sure I was. I thought Lucy was gonna kill me.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: He stole my report! That's my report!

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: We know, Audrey.

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: It's all my fault. What have I done, Animal? What have I become? Look at me. This isn't me. I don't do things like this.

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: You made a mistake.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Yeah, I just screwed up with the only man who ever really cared about me.

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: Didn't you tell me he left for the airport?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Yeah. Why are you asking?

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: I just saw him. He's with a bunch of guys who want to sneak into the city tonight.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: My God. He's going after the nest.

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: Perfect! You wanted a story, well, baby, you got one.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Animal, I can't.

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: Look, you want to make it up to your friend? Well if he's right, this is your chance.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: Lucy'd kill me if she knew.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: It's the maintenance entrance. Runs along the side of the tunnel. When they repaired it last year I worked on a piece about it.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Don't you think we have enough?

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: Yes. Definitely. Definitely enough.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Think we can fit up in there?

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: Only one way to find out.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: He's not going to do it.

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: Oh yes he will.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Cut uptown, take 8th to 57th then cut up Broadway.

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: You're crazy, go to the east side and take the park avenue to the JFK.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: The JFK? In the rain!?

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: What are you talking about? The east side is always faster.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: But we can get to the west side faster.

turns.speaker: ANIMAL
turns.text: Audrey, did you take the tape out of the camera?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I'll take them all.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: You must have quite some harem.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Audrey?! Is that you? Hi, hello. You look, wow, uh, how've you been?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: It's good to see you, Nick.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: So you made it.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You're a reporter. That's what you always wanted to be, right? I'm happy for you. Really, I am.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Yeah, well...

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: So, you still picking apart cockroaches?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No, I'm into earthworms now. You wouldn't be interested. They're real "boring" creatures. Very reliable, dependable, no surprises...

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: You're still mad at me, aren't you?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You just left me without a phone call, a letter, nothing. All this time. Yeah, I guess I'm still a little mad.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: That was eight years ago. Some people change, you know.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Most people don't.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: I'm sorry you feel that way.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Wait. I'm sorry. You're right. Eight years is a long time. Can I offer you a cup of tea?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Sure. I'd like that.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: I still can't believe it. How does a guy go from an anti-nuke activists to working for the Nuclear Regulatory Commission?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: When you and I use to attend rallies in college, we helped to create awareness. But from the inside now I can actually effect change.  I never lost my idealism.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: And exactly what changes are you trying to effect?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I have this theory that we're inadvertently creating new species as a direct result of what we've done to nature.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: And you think this creature is one of them?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yes. The first of its kind. I found this blood sample earlier this evening...

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Blood sample? How close did you get to that thing?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I got pretty close.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: What else do you know about it?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: ...he's pregnant.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Well, obviously these tests weren't designed for this but fundamentally they're looking for the same hormonal patterns that would indicate pregnancy.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: I don't get it. If it's the first of its kind, how can it be pregnant?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: The ultimate expression of evolution, it reproduces asexually. Think about it, all kinds of creatures have been known to travel great distances for reproduction. That's why he came to New York. Like every species of insufficient progenitors, he's nesting!

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Nesting?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Yes. Do you realize that a creature like this could lay as many as a dozen eggs at a time!

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Is this cause of me? Because of the story?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Well what the hell did you think was going to happen?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: You never said it was off the record.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I shouldn't have to, Audrey. You're supposed to be my friend. I trusted you.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: I didn't mean for it to turn out like this.  Look, I lied to you. I'm not a reporter. When we broke up and I came out to New York I was so sure I'd make it. But I haven't. That's why I needed this story so bad. I just couldn't tell you I'm a failure.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: So you thought that made it okay to steal my tapes?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What are you doing here?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: I thought you said there'd only be a dozen eggs.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I was wrong.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Circuits are overloaded.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: I know a way. I know how you can get a message out of here.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Come on, the broadcast booth is right over here.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Our network covers the Ranger games.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: The network is on an intranet. It's a direct feed into our computer system.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Your station won't have any easier time contacting the military than I did.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: If the military are listening, they must immediately destroy this building before they can escape.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Oh my God! They're coming!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Are you okay?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Somehow I never thought your life was this exciting.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You'd be surprised.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Really? I'd like to find out.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Who was that French guy, anyway.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Oh, just some insurance guy.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: And I'm supposed to remind you to call him on all of Caiman's expense p.o.'s.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Speak of the devil.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: My life sucks.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Oh, please, your life doesn't suck. His life sucks.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: I can't believe he put the moves on me. After everything I've done for him.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: He's scum! As far as he's concerned you're just a pair of breasts that talk.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: It's Nick! I know that guy. I know him!

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Who is he?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: He was my college sweetie! Look at him. He looks so handsome on t.v. What the hell is he doing in Panama.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Did Romeo have a name?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Nick Tatopoulos.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Four years. Girl, I'm surprised he didn't ask you to marry him.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: That's the problem. He did.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: What the hell are you doing?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Remember my friend we saw on t.v.?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Your old sweetheart?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Yeah, well he just turned up in New Jersey at the military command post. Somehow all this is related to what happened down in Panama. There's a story here. I know it. You got any tape or glue?

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I left my forgery kit back at the office.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Wish me luck!

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Audrey, I don't think this is a very good idea. Caiman finds out and he'll have your job.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: I'm tired of waiting for someone else to give me an opportunity, Luce. If there's a story here I'm going to find it.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Hey, do you have any glue in your bag?

turns.speaker: KID
turns.text: What's it to you?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Can I use some?

turns.speaker: KID
turns.text: What do I get?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: The warm feeling of helping your fellow man.

turns.speaker: KID
turns.text: Five bucks.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: You're kidding, right?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Did you talk with Humphries?

turns.speaker: CAIMAN
turns.text: This is not the place...

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Just tell me, did you talk with him?

turns.speaker: CAIMAN
turns.text: He said he'd consider it. It's between you and Rodriguez.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Are you serious? He's going to consider me for he job? What else did he say?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Mr. Caiman, you're married.

turns.speaker: CAIMAN
turns.text: And you're beautiful...

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Mr. Caiman...

turns.speaker: CAIMAN
turns.text: Call me Charlie.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Mr. Caiman, I've been doing extra research for you after hours and weekends for nearly a year. And I've never asked for anything but this job is really important to me. I'm too old to be an assistant anymore. I need to know this job is going someplace.

turns.speaker: CAIMAN
turns.text: So have dinner with me tonight.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: I can't.

turns.speaker: CAIMAN
turns.text: It's your choice.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Caiman, wait. Take me with you.

turns.speaker: CAIMAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: I've got something on this. I know a guy on the inside with the military...

turns.speaker: CAIMAN
turns.text: Not now. You got my bag?

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: You don't understand, I can get us information...

turns.speaker: CAIMAN
turns.text: Listen, this is the time when the big boys have to go to work, okay Honey?

turns.speaker: CAIMAN
turns.text: We did it! We've got the exclusive! Way to go, Audrey!

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: We? I don't think so.

turns.speaker: CAIMAN
turns.text: I want that story, Audrey. Remember you work for me.

turns.speaker: AUDREY
turns.text: Not anymore. Mr. Caiman, I quit.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hi. Nick Tatopoulos...

turns.speaker: ELSIE
turns.text: Ah, Elsie Chapman, paleontologist.

turns.speaker: ELSIE
turns.text: Three years digging up worms in Chernobyl? How did Mrs. Tatopoulos handle it?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Oh, I'm not married.

turns.speaker: ELSIE
turns.text: Really? A girlfriend then?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: No. Perhaps I work too much.

turns.speaker: ELSIE
turns.text: You mean to tell me that there is no one who holds a special place in your heart?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Not for a long time, now.

turns.speaker: ELSIE
turns.text: Well, I think you're cute.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Oh, thank you.  Is she always like this?

turns.speaker: ELSIE
turns.text: Hence the radiation.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: More than that. I believe this is a mutated aberration, a hybrid from the fall out in that region.

turns.speaker: ELSIE
turns.text: Evacuate Manhattan? That's over three million people. Has that ever been done before?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: ELSIE
turns.text: I'm sorry about all this.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Me too.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Make sure they find that nest before it's too late.

turns.speaker: ELSIE
turns.text: I'll try.

turns.speaker: JEAN-CLAUDE
turns.text: Merde!

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Allez, allez!

turns.speaker: JEAN-CLAUDE
turns.text: They will set the trap at thirty minutes to ten.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: That is when we will go in.

turns.speaker: JEAN-CLAUDE
turns.text: We've secured the doors on both levels.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Where's Luc and Pierre?

turns.speaker: JEAN-CLAUDE
turns.text: They didn't make it.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Nick, my men and I will hold them here. You will have to go and get help!

turns.speaker: LT. ANDERSON
turns.text: When we learned he could burrow his way through the tunnels we realized he could be out of the quarantined zone.

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: Christ. How many tunnels lead off the island?

turns.speaker: LT. ANDERSON
turns.text: Only five, Sir. We've checked them all. He hasn't used any of them.

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: Have them sealed off.

turns.speaker: LT. ANDERSON
turns.text: And how should we do that, Sir?

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: Fill them with cement, brick them up, put land mines in them, bombs, I don't know, just make sure that goddamned thing doesn't leave the island!

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: Who are they? Lieutenant, get those people away from there.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: They are with me!

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: CHARGEURES, property and casualty insurance. We are preparing a report.

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: You're fast.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: That is our job.

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: Well your people are getting in the way of my job.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Major, what do you think could have done this?

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: Get your people out of there or I will.

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: Dr. Niko Topopolosis?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: It's Tatopoulos.

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: Right. The worm guy.  Can someone get those people off the beach?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Excuse me, would you mind telling me what the hell I'm doing here?

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: Follow me.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: You didn't answer my question. In fact, for the last 18 hours no one has answered any of my questions.

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: We have a situation on our hands that requires your particular expertise.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Look, I may work for the Nuclear Regulatory Commission but accidents and spills are not my field.

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: We know.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Do you know that you just interrupted a three year study of the Chernobyl earthworm?

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: Yeah, you're the worm guy.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: The radioactive contamination in that area altered the earthworm's DNA! You have any idea what that means?

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: No, but I have the feeling I'm about to find out.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: It means that due to a man made accident the Chernobyl earthworms are now over seventeen percent larger than they were before. Mutated by seventeen percent?

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: Seventeen percent, huh? Sounds big.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: They're enormous! A new species created by man's recklessness. That's what I've been trying to tell you, I'm only a biologist. I take radioactive samples and study them.

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: Then you're perfect.  Here's your radioactive sample. Study it.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What sample?

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: You're standing on it.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: That was a footprint. I was standing inside a footprint.

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: But there's no animal in the world that can make prints like that? Is there?

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: We're hoping you're going to help us figure that out.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Somebody must have seen it.

turns.speaker: MAJOR HICKS
turns.text: It happened so fast no one knew what hit them 'til is was over.
